revised_title: Molecular Interpretation of Thermoelastic Properties in Muscle
tldr: The authors investigated the effect of temperature change on the elastic force of a stretched muscle. They concluded that the elastic system of muscle consists of flexible, primary-valence chain molecules that become ordered when stretched and return to a random arrangement with thermal agitation. The elastic force increases more rapidly at intermediate elongations, and latent heat is set free during stretching. X-ray studies support the molecular interpretation of the muscle's viscous-elastic properties.
